Reviews.Title: “First class 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: AyyadAyyad
Reviews.Content: Good location close to Messe! Close to Kurfuerstendamm and city centre

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: huda71
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel many times. It is aGood hotel, clean, friendly staff, comfortable rooms, good breakfast, and good location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, OK location”
Reviews.Author: natdh
Reviews.Content: Working in travel at the time and having been to Berlin on a number of occasions I was asked to take a group of travel agents on an educational trip to the city and this hotel was our base. Rooms are spacious and clean. The breakfast was typical German continental with plenty of choice and the restaurant has great views. The staff were great, especially the bar man in the evening who went out of his way to be helpful and friendly. Location isn't as good as other hotels I have stayed in, however the public transport in Berlin is outstanding and there are S & U Bhan stations close by to reach all the main attractions. I would stay here again as the hotel itself is lovely.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: dog2004
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent, the room in a good standard, but it took some time to find out where to find the reception, and only one elevator could be a problem

Reviews.Title: “good location for Trade fair events”
Reviews.Author: hcii
Reviews.Content: clean and quitt Business Hotel conveniejtly located Close to the Trade fair Center. denkbarer or rebhult in the Late nineties which isbeasily reckt izable by the interior design and furniture. clean and quiet. some ok Restaurants in walking distance. all in all good value but no Charme.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: elninomagico
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth visit to Berlin and my fourth hotel within the city. I ended up booking through Priceline and it didn't supply me with the deal I was hoping for due to an error in the booking engine; therefore I ended up paying more than the standard rate for the hotel. Oh well! We upgraded to a bigger room and it was worth it. Bathroom was very spacious, extremely clean and the rooms were serviced each day. Location is good, close to the S-Bahn and U-Bahn to travel to Ku'damm etc. There is also a McDonald's directly underneath the hotel. Staff was extremely helpful and friendly, especially the Polish waiter. The lifts didn't cause us problems whatsoever, pretty straight -forward really! The hotel has a lovely terrace where one can sit outside in the warmer weather and have a few drinks: this is what we did. Would stay here again. Good hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A median hotel with an elevator twist”
Reviews.Author: pelicanoPortugal
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the main lobby at the top floor (7th) and has only one elevator to go up and another solo elevator to go to the bedrooms. Every time you want to go out you have to pass the reception and switch elevator and smell the restaurant. Very confuse and sure not practical. The staff and the location were OK. I got a beatifull room, big, with a enormous window and a bathtub without shower curtains. The bad side were the complete lack of amenietis, the small TV almost without non.german channels and the bad mattress. The breakfast were OK and the room is nice. They only have 1 PC with free internet. It's not that good hotel and i'm sure you can find more for the same money.

Reviews.Title: “We love it!”
Reviews.Author: jcu1963
Reviews.Content: Service, security, staff -- all excellent. This was our 2nd time in less than three years to stay at the Domicil, and when we return to Berlin, we will stay there again. The only recommendation I would make is to try to have a room that does not face directly over Kantstrasse. It could be a bit noisy with the window open at night. The accessibility to the S- and U-Bahns is perfect affording those with train connections at the main Berlin Hauptbahnhof ease of access.

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: chanvannak
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very bad. We are from Asia, their receptionist staffs look at us such as we don’t have money to pay them. Or we are not as good at them. I have to say that it deserves to be 2 stars normal hotel in all features: such as: service, facility, amenity, breakfast, cleanness…etc while their price is too expensive comparing to what the hotel has for offer. They confirmed us at Double Room, but we have checked in, it is 2 connecting bad rooms. Everything in this hotel charged including Internet, some TV Channels…etc. In the room, there is no bathroom facility such as: comb, shampoo…etc. In addition, the breakfast is really limited. I can say that it is about the same to 2 star hotel’s breakfast in other places. Note: be careful that you will be high over charged if you go to book directly with the hotel. And it is better to stay at other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Frustrating customer service”
Reviews.Author: EverettEightball
Reviews.Content: Before checking in, we asked for a second bed in the room. After arriving in Berlin, we stopped at the room and assumed that the room sofa was a pullout bed. We then did some sightseeing (the Reichstag was amazing) and returned to the room in the evening. After discovering that the couch was just a couch, we called the front desk to ask another bed be sent down to the room. We were rudely told that we had not requested such a bed and that we would have to request a new bed in the morning. We muddled through at night, then requested a second bed when we passed by the desk in the morning. After that day's sightseeing, we returned to the room to discover that there was no second bed in the room. When we called the desk, they immediately sent a woman down with the bed who apologized profusely and claimed that the front desk had been busy the previous evening and that they had forgotten to put in our order. This was not the sort of service we would have expected from a nice hotel. Aside from that, the Domicil was OK. The breakfast bar was nice if overpriced, and the rooms were decent, though there were some tiles that had broken off of the sink in our bathroom. If we were to come back to Berlin, we'd likely stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowStar
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very average. The main problem is not only that reception is on the top floor of the hotel (which means that you must spend a lot of time going up and down in lifts) but also the very hot rooms. It was peak summer when we visited so the lack of AC made the room unbearable (if you opened the windows you might as well have been sleeping in the middle of the very noisy street below). The staff are friendly enough though and the lovely roof terrace made for a nice place to have an evening drink before a night out.

Reviews.Title: “Charming. Definitely recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Michael59Toronto
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable 2-night stay here. The front desk staff are very pleasant and helpful. The rooms are large and bright. Reception is on the seventh floor and is attached to a delightful café and outdoor patio with a great view. The bartender pleasantly insisted we drink only German wine and beer. Breakfast was excellent. Lots of great restaurants within walking distance. They rent bikes and provide reduced rates at the fitness centre across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: gena67
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at the corner of a busy street and a pedestrian area. Parking is only available at the shopping center across the street. Not very central location, but subway station is right at the entrance. The reception is on the top floor and since the hotel doesn't have plastic key cards, every time you enter or leave the hotel you have to go to the reception and get/return the keys. Our room was at the second floor and reception is at 7th. Not too convenient, but not a big problem either. The hallway has a persistant smell of tobacco smoke, but the rooms are well isolated. No bath tub in the rooms, but otherwise bathroom is ok. Shopping/dining is right downstairs. Exceptionally friendly stuff (compensates all possible inconveniences).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Svala
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this hotel, and had chosen it based on the reviews. And we were not disappointed. The hotel is very nice, the rooms ok, the breakfast very ok, you feel very safe. And also the breakfast room/bar is a very nice room to stay in. You feel at home and the staff is very helpful. Close to the hotel we found nice shops, the U-bahn, S-Bahn and buses are very close by and also there is a shop with gourmet food 100 m away. If I go to Berlin again I will definitely stay at this hotel. Perhaps I must add that before we stayed in this hotel we stayed two nights in a 5-star hotel in Berlin. That hotel was of course more luxurious, but not so personal and cosy as hotel Domicil.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mld80
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and my two children (ages 8 and 10) stayed at this property for about 6 days. The room was spacious, clean and had a beautiful view! The windows open big but if you have children it is nice to know that there is glass on the outside of the building as well so that you can cool off but not have to worry about accidents. The bathroom was super big and the bathtub was absolutely fabulous and very appreciated after all that walking around beautiful Berlin! There was a comfortable sofa bed for the kiddies, a comfy big bed for my husband and I and a hidden away well appointed kitchen. The kitchen had a couple of burners, pots and pans, a sink and a refrigerator. I should say that we did not do any cooking but it was nice to know we could if we wanted to. There was a desk and the television has some English language programs but I much preferred watching Home Improvement with dubbed German! Breakfast was extensive and well stocked every morning with sausage, bacon, eggs, crepes, rolls, croissants, fresh fruit, cold meats, cheeses, tea, coffee and the list could go on. We were very impressed and the breakfast was included in our room rate. Our Europe trip lasted a month and I don't hesitate to say that the Domicil was my favorite hotel all around. This hotel is about a block away from the S Bahn which goes anywhere in Berlin in no time. There is also a U Bahn station right outside the door. If we go back to Berlin (which we will soon I hope) we will certainly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin base”
Reviews.Author: sandSheffield
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Berlin for 5 nights and found the Domicil met all our needs. The hotel benefits from the close attention of the owners who clearly have trained the staff well - for example the extensive breakfast bar was regularly refreshed, even up to the end of the breakfast service. The hotel is convenient for the S Bahn, with Charlottenburg station only 150 meters away.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChestnutandLaguna
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Very central - undeground just 1 min away, train staion - 5 minutes. Bus right there and it's only 5-7 minutes to the Zoo and main attractions. Shops, pharmacy and eating places are just around the corner. Reception located on the 7th floor - very unusual but beatiful, have you ever checked in close to the roof, with the view of the cafe on the balcony and the city from above? Nice helpful staff, clean and comfortable rooms, and sound-proof windows. You would not need them if you have windows to the backyard. Very mig electronics shop - Media Markt just around the corner - the prices in Germany are pretty low, so if you are up to buy some high-tech, that's the way to go. The price of the hotel is also pretty reasonable. I booked it through bookings. com. Enjoy! Pov

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: P6228
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend in Berlin and stayed at this excellent hotel. We found all the staff helpful and able to answer all our question from where's the best place to eat & whats the best places to go sight seeing in a short amount of time. The hotel was very easy to reach by train and underground. The hotel bedrooms where very comfortable with plenty of space, it had a lovely bathroom with large showers and plenty of hot water and a small kitchen area. Breakfast was excellent and being buffet style left it up to you how much you ate. Myself and five others stayed in 3 double rooms on this week-end trip and all agreed the hotel was excellent value for money. Hope this review helps.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for Berlin”
Reviews.Author: BearsdenBrian
Reviews.Content: We stayed there last weekend and had a very good experience. The hotel looks fairly new and modern. One little quirk, as mentioned before, is that you go from street level in a dedicated elevator to the reception/bar/dining area on the 7th floor then take another lift down to whichever floor you are staying. In our case the 2nd. It would have been easier to use the stairs but I suppose security deemed this necessary. The room was neat and we had a sort of kitchen that looked like a wardrobe, behind the room door. We didn't actually notice it until we asked where our mini bar was as we couldn't find it in the usual place. The mini kitchen had a fridge and cooker and sink. Different!! Only one minor gripe. Suprisingly for a new building, there was no A/C. There was a fan in the room but as it was about 30C last weekend it was a bit stuffy. Staff all very pleasant and all spoke english. Breakfasts were great. Choice of the usual bacon, egg type things and extensive range of fruits, bread and cold meats/cheeses. The wasps found the meat particularly appealing.. As the weather was fine we ate on the outdoor roof terrace which was a bonus. Great for public transport. If you fly into Schoenfeld, take the S9 train (2.60 euros one way...a bargain) and get off at Charlottenburg..just behind the hotel. It takes about 45 minutes. To travel about this lovely city I would recommend getting a day ticket from any station or bus etc. which costs 5.80 euros and you can use the overground and underground trains, buses and trams unlimited. The city covers a large area so no matter where your hotel is you'll probably do a fair bit of travelling around on public transport which appears to me to be plentiful. Don't believe the poor review, the majority have got it right

Reviews.Title: “Don't come in the summer.”
Reviews.Author: israelifamily
Reviews.Content: Berlin's summer has some hot day's, we arrived on such. There is no A.C., and we were told that " tommorow we'll get a fan". Other than that the staff went crazy when we said we want to transfer to a hotel with A.C. The beds are extremely soft if you like such. I don't know who wrote the previous reviews, but maybe someone on the management has decent english ( the staff don't).

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: 888travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and were very pleased with the standard of accommodation. We had a big clean, modern room with a sofa etc. and plenty of space to walk around. There were rounded windows with a a view over the shopping streets below - many dept stores are 50m away and open until 7pm or later and plenty of places to eat, too. We had requested a cot for our young daughter and the staff had made up a lovely bed for her with teddy duvet etc. which was great. The bus stop is just outside the door and the U-bahn station Wilmersdorferstr is literally 20m away (something that was not clear from other reviews so transport links were brilliant). We would definitely stay here again. The only minor downside is the road noise so not really practical to keep the window ajar at night time.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: South Shieds, Tyne and Wear, England
Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Berlin, and stayed at this hotel, which we found to be just like the pictures on the internet. We found the hotel to be of a very high standard and to be warm and friendly, staff were excellent and very helpful. The buffett breakfast was excellent and there was ample choice for everyone. The location of this hotel is excellent for exploring, as there is the underground 2 minutes walk, the s bahn is a five minute walk round the corner and the buses stop just up the road which means you can plan your route. The transport system was easy to get around on and ran regularly. We would certainly stop here again and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Viking59
Reviews.Content: From the smiling receptionist on arrival to the stunning views over the city from the breakfast bar this was a relaxing and pleasant place to stay. Breakfasts were freshly prepared and well presented with lots of choice. The rooms were clean and well furnished and bathroom facilities were very good. Staff were helpful and polite throughout our stay. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful view over the city”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Domicil is different to the normal "chain Hotels". It started with the service which was very caring. You will definitely not miss any attraction with this crew. What was also different is the fact that reception and restaurant are located on the 7nth floor. You can take your breakfast on the meditteranean roof garden terrace and enjoy the wonderful view over the city. I also liked the design of the Hotel. It was no artificial but a warm "feel at home" atmosphere. Together with the good location near the Kurfürstendamm this Hotel is a real Insider!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Domicil was a very good find, stayed for five nights in June 2004 and was very pleased with the accommodation and service. Rooms were very quiet, comfortable and spacious with tasteful contemporary furnishings, high quality beds and fine modern bathrooms. Staff were attentive and friendly. Rooftop restaurant with ample buffet breakfast. A high standard of hotel for a reasonable price. Just outside the hotel is a neighbourhood shopping district with supermarket and department stores and local restaurants. Excellent location away from the busiest parts of Berlin, but within easy reach of them by U-Bahn from the station outside the hotel or by the crosstown S-Bahn from around the corner. Also easy to get to Spandau and Potsdam from this part of town for day trips and the bus to Tegel Airport stops around the corner.
